title: Constructivist book cover Putin's Wars
content:
This is the cover of \_Putin's Wars: The Rise of Russia's New Imperialism\_ by Marcel H. Van Herpen published in 2014 by Roman & Littlefield

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162806im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PutinsWarsSM_5184.jpg)
  
A larger scale image is attached.  
My search for a constructivist font drew a blank. Perhaps I was looking in the wrong places.  
Don

comments.content:
**[Molot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162806/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-5%20%2F%20%28Freemium%29&ffam=Molot%20-%20Regular&fid=41fd7a16df8966e172c862ca3875679f&fsize=60&text=PUTIN%2CS%20WARS%20IMPERIALISM&wrap=2)** free font by Roman Yershov, Jovanny Lemonad [2008] looks like a match.  
A comma "," is probably used to simulate the missing(?) apostrophe.

Many thanks Fivos. For a free font it works very well.  
Update:  
A well made Russian looking font that avoids silly features, like a reversed \_R\_ for \_A\_, and includes a correct Cyrillic alphabet that harmonizes well with the Latin letters.  
This one goes in my favorites list.  
Don
